intro: Gibbaeum nebrownii subsp. nebrownii, commonly known as the Nebrown's knysna glory, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are thick and cylindrical, often covered in a waxy cuticle to reduce water loss. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically during the summer months.
